intro: Vochysia santaluciae, commonly known as the Santa Lucia velvetwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Chrysobalanaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Vochysia santaluciae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
